bridge-type.label: Serial Bridge
bridge-type.description: The M-Bus Serial bridge allows to poll data using compatible serial interfaces.

parameter-group.name: discovery
parameter-group.label: Discovery
parameter-group.description: Control options for behavior of device discovery.

parameter-group.name: serial
parameter-group.label: Serial port settings
parameter-group.description: Settings related to hardware adapter communication. Most common mode is Data Bits: 8, parity: none, stop bits: 1. Baud rate depends on manufacturer - use 19200 for Radio Crafts, 9600 for Amber Wireless and 57600 for IMST.

parameter.name: dataBits
parameter.label: Baud rate
parameter.description: Data bits in each serial transmission.

parameter.name: discoverDevices
parameter.label: Discover devices
parameter.description: Turn on or off discovery of new devices for this interface.

parameter.name: discoveryTimeToLive
parameter.label: Time to live
parameter.description: Time to live (TTL) in minutes for discovered elements. After passing of TTL element will be removed, possibly re-discovered when appears again. This setting can be used to discard invalid records produced by unstable radio interface. Please note that some devices may have irregular communication schedule. Value of -1 disables time to live. Common values are 60 (one hour) and 1440 (one day).

parameter.name: discoveryMethod
parameter.label: Discovery method
parameter.description: Scan method used for discovery of devices connected to this M-Bus bridge.

parameter.name: wildcardMask
parameter.label: Wildcard mask
parameter.description: Address mask (in hex format) used to scan secondary addresses on the bus. Used only if 'Secondary address' scan is enabled.
